website_summaries.verdict: While a bit pricey, you will be getting a super durable steel rack that can hold up to 4.4 lbs. of pasta at a time.
pros: 16 rods in all hold up to 4.4 lbs
Comes with a wand to easily pick up pasta
cons: The bottom half of the drying rods are positioned very low, so pasta drags on the counter

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: My only complaints are that it is a little pricey and the legs could be a little easier to set and retract (especially for the money.) But it’s very attractive and the design is very clever for storage and it does hold a lot of noodles. Overall I’m very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: MsDelilah

customer_reviews.title: like it, but pricey...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this product, a little on the pricey side, and no instructions came with it. Kind of awkward to use the wand as it really didn't have any instructions on the best way to use it. I wish the height could be extended because when I put the pasta to dry on the bottom arm, it reaches the counter already. But product seems sturdy and I love the color. I'm not sure if it's worth the purchase, but I'll give it another try.
customer_reviews.author: Alibabalu

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rack
customer_reviews.text: Well made with lots of drying rods, but ridiculously expensive. The tops of each leg of the tripod base had some sharp edges which should have been removed. Unexpected downside: the pasta sticks to the drying rods if left for a while. After a couple hours when the pasta if fully dry it comes off the rods readily. However, if you want to use the pasta shortly after you make it, but don't get to it right away then some of it will be sticking resulting in breaking or tearing of the pasta. Don't recall any instructions. If there were any included maybe they said to oil the rods. Will try that next time.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: A good drying rack for pasta
customer_reviews.text: Stand is very functional for home made pasta the only con is the height which if you want to use half the horizontal bars you must cut your noodles in half or they hit the counter below it. I like the ability to fold it up and store it. I also like the handling rod for putting the pasta on and taking it off the horizontal rods. Something most of the others i looked at do not have.
customer_reviews.author: burnt thumbs

customer_reviews.title: great for dryhg pasta
customer_reviews.text: I love this pasta dryer. You just twist it open and the arms are all exposed. You pull out the legs which are rubber on the bottom so they won't shift. so easy to set up and clean. the legs are metal and the arms a heavy plastic. Very well made. I also have a wooden dryer but it takes up more room to store and harder to assemble and to clean.
customer_reviews.author: robbie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and store
customer_reviews.text: Happy overall. One complain is the foot. If I want to move it after pasta are on it, it will become super difficult since these three things will fall when I lift them, then very hard to settle down by myself. But it can be solved if I have a company.
customer_reviews.author: Ag

customer_reviews.title: Bravo Great product
customer_reviews.text: I'm an ex chef and avid home cook. I recently started getting back into fresh pasta and was in need of a new rack. I was hoping there was something kinda cool and innovative . There it was. It looked pretty cool but as good in practice? It was. At the risk of sounding like an infomercial, It sets and breaks down in a snap. No more difficult than an umbrella. It holds a lot of pasta. I made a four cup recipe and it held the whole thing. Cleans up with a wipe to each spindle. It's also easy to store. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Best pasta rack you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for about five years and have used it more times than I can count. I love mine so much that I bought this one for my friend for her birthday! The Marcato pasta drying rack is very stable, has a good amount of space that will hold about two pounds of pasta, doesn't fall apart while hanging the freshly cut pasta (like the wooden racks do), comes apart for easy washing, can be flattened if it needs to be stored...it's perfect! If you're looking for a good pasta drying rack, look no farther. It will be money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: nancy b

customer_reviews.title: Simple and clean
customer_reviews.text: While the tripod feet are very clumsy when setting this down or moving it slightly on the counter, the design is otherwise perfect. Easy to clean, and very handy wand to place pasta on the stand is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: A. O. Reason

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I really needed a place to store noodles before freezing/cooking them. This tree is exactly that. I am absolutely in love with it. My grandma was so jealous she went out and immediately purchased one of her own. The tree is lightweight and extremely compact so I can store it with the noodle attachments. The included noodle wand works just fine, I tend to prefer my hands but it does work. Noodles dry really quickly on the tree as compared to stung about the countertop.
customer_reviews.author: BuysFromAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Work of Art
customer_reviews.text: The best pasta drying rack I have ever seen or used
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I went to use this for the first time the other day, only to find the last rung cracked around the spring. So it collapses and is too low to place pasta on. Can I please have a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: As a matter of fact, I DID give one as a gift . . .
customer_reviews.text: . . . and they are thrilled!! 'Nuff said. Works as well mine has for years.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Donahue

customer_reviews.title: The best thing is the wand that allows you to lift ...
customer_reviews.text: Remarkable quality! It’s real stable and there is lots of room for lots of noodles. The best thing is the wand that allows you to lift and readily deliver noodles to the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lowder

customer_reviews.title: Works great, larger than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, Folds up/collapses for easy storage. It was taller than I expected but is just right for draping my fresh pasta to dry.
customer_reviews.author: WNCChip

customer_reviews.title: its a stand, but the pins are too close ...
customer_reviews.text: its a stand, but the pins are too close and the top insert holds water and rusts inside the center pipe, so handwash only and even then very infrequently
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Moore

customer_reviews.title: Just a well built pasta rack...
customer_reviews.text: Well designed Just amazing how it opens up spins into place and the prop legs pop out,well machined
customer_reviews.author: James L. Glancy

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous pasta rack ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking at several sites for just the right pasta drying rack. At first I wanted a wooden one then my husband said to get a stainless steel one but couldn't find one. So in further searching I found this one. I was skeptical on how much the rack will hold but to my surprise it held alot of pasta. I highly recommend this product it's compact, easy to store and holds alot too. The wand makes it so easy to slid your fresh noodles on the rack. Very easy to clean and you don't have to worry about bacteria because the rods are coded with plastic. I'm going to get me another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Eye Candy Pasta Drying Rack!
customer_reviews.text: Made in Italy, great quality. Love the rod that stores in the top center of rack to transfer pasta from pasta roller to the drying rack. Easy to wipe clean and folds up slim for storage. Visually appealing method to dry your fresh homemade pasta! Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A Weese

customer_reviews.title: Great product. It works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and easy to use. Good material quality and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: MARCO

customer_reviews.title: Very stable, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This product works exactly as described. Not only is it easy to store, but the plastic drying rods are easily wiped down after use. I could have saved a good deal of money by buying a wooden rack, but as a bit of a health freak, I don't use wooden food-handling products in the kitchen as they tend to hold bacteria. This rack is very stable and should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Duane A. Priest

customer_reviews.title: Best design EVER...
customer_reviews.text: That is, if you're looking for a great pasta dryer. I've used several designs over the years and this one is absolutely, hands down, the very best design. And it's pretty. And my gadget loving husband adores it. When I get it out to dry fresh pasta I have to shoo him out of the kitchen to keep him from playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: DeborahDarlingTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful blue Marcato pasta drying rack!!!  Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived super fast and in perfect condition!!! I really enjoy using it to dry my pasta. It is not only beautiful but a very efficient tool to have in the kitchen!!! Nice quality!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fabulous
customer_reviews.text: This was one of our best buys. We were having a dinner party and making fresh, homemade pasta. This handy tool was perfect and did its job. When we are not using it, we keep it in the box that it arrive in. We don't have a lot of storage space in the kitchen and want to keep this handy tool safe for future use.
customer_reviews.author: tld

customer_reviews.title: beautiful in red!!!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived perfectly. super speedy delivery. would strongly recommend!!!! :) :) :)
customer_reviews.author: sugar2183

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Would buy again! This makes the pasta process so much easier
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect noodle drying rack
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing!!! The different height level is perfect for different length of pasta!!
customer_reviews.author: AntoninaBecker

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely made. LOVE this thing
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made. LOVE this thing! It is great for drying the pasta, eye candy while doing it and easy to swing the arms out as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Compact storage.  Sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.text: Folds up flat and easy to store. Holds a ton of pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Froglips

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: This product is basically exactly what you would imagine, except for one really nice feature: when you twist the top one way, all of the arms automatically form the spiral shown in the image--you don't have to mess with each of them individually to get them where you want. Twist the top the other way and all of the arms line up for storage. The feet that form the tripod base also slide up for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great results
customer_reviews.text: Highest quality construction. Successfully used it several times now with great results.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Marcato Pasta drying rack
customer_reviews.text: It serves the purpose of drying freshly made pasta very well. Since it has many spokes it can handle a whole batch of pasta. it is also very stable & does not take up much space to store. I am really glad I bought it, though it is a bit pricey for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: COOK-A-HOLIC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to clean pasta rack
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy- able to hold pasta around entire rack Easy to clean Fold flat for storage
customer_reviews.author: Dr. I

customer_reviews.title: It broke after 3 uses.
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice but broke after 3 uses. I don't know whom to contact to buy a replacement part.
customer_reviews.author: Dano@Nudge

customer_reviews.title: We love this pasta rack
customer_reviews.text: We love this pasta rack. It's simple to use and does its job. It folds nicely and is somewhat easy to store when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love the wand!
customer_reviews.text: The wand makes it so easy to transfer pasta to the rack. Enough space for one standard recipe (about a lb) of pasta. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected. Folds up very compact and is relatively easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: A. K.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift. Recipient said it worked great!!!
customer_reviews.author: The Irishman

customer_reviews.title: Marcato Atlas pasta dyring rack
customer_reviews.text: What a beautiful pasta rack! There are plenty of arms to hang pasta and tall enough for my need. Worth every penny. Good quality. I would recommend these rack to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Tran

customer_reviews.title: Low use but high potential
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used this much but it has high hopes. My wife and I are just getting into homemade pasta so it will take time to get much out of this. So far though it has been quite valuable.
customer_reviews.author: Shane and Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Typical great Mercato quality
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It works as designed. After struggling with a cheap wooden drying rack this makes hanging the pasta a breeze. I highly recommend it for the simplicity and the great. Quality of construction.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Cardani

customer_reviews.title: Wow! This works great!
customer_reviews.text: It was larger than I thought it was but it works really well. I am so glad I didn't get the cheaper one because this one really fits the bill. It is well made and makes pasta making much simpler because the prongs separate on each level.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great durability
customer_reviews.text: I love this , it can hold a lot of pasta and easy to open and easy to close up and put away
customer_reviews.author: Dessery Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device
customer_reviews.text: We make pasta quite often and this little pasta-hanging device is the cat's meow! It holds an incredible amount of pasta, cleans up easily, and folds up in a flash. Great buy... great drying rack. We've gotten one for each of our five kids who have also gotten into pasta-making.
customer_reviews.author: Travis H. Redman Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Works just as easy as they show on their video. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable and good quality
customer_reviews.text: This pasta rack does the job, it is made well of quality parts and good construction, and will give you no problems. I LOVE HOMEMADE PASTA AND YOU WILL TOO!!
customer_reviews.author: LovetoCookTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this pasta drying rack. It works just the way it claims to work. It is easy to clean and store. See my photo for how it looks with pasta loaded onto it. <sung to tune of "Lemon Tree"> Pasta tree very pretty And the pasta flour is wheat But the fruit of the poor pasta Must be boiled before we eat
customer_reviews.author: S. Linkletter

customer_reviews.title: excellent pasta rack
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design leads to a wonderful, versatile tool. Especially enjoy the wand to help guide pasta on to the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Sprinkle

customer_reviews.title: Functional with Flair
customer_reviews.text: Not just fun, this thing is well engineered and works great. Can't imagine trying to dry home made noodles without it!
customer_reviews.author: Sonnet

customer_reviews.title: Lots of space
customer_reviews.text: There are so many sticks to put pasta on, can dry alot more then most other racks. Sturdy and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product this has been preforming well, I expect it to last a long time well built for the money
customer_reviews.author: Fishing.775

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Compact and easy to use. Just wish the price was a little lower. But worth it. Would recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Boccaccio

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for hanging fresh pasta, folds down so it doesn't take up a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Twardowski

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, nice materials, and the transfer wand is very helpful for stringy pasta. The only design change I would recommend is height, although making the pasta strings shorter eliminates this problem. The Tacapasta is a little pricey, but I can deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Bigger and Nicer Than "Plastic" Would Indicate, Still Expensive
customer_reviews.text: It's bigger than the picture might indicate, but folds up pretty nicely, and the feet are of higher quality than you might imagine. Still, I might have ordered the $10 wooden legs if I had known it didn't fold up more compactly, but no doubt this will work better. Worth about $20-30, not the $40 they charge here, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: HatchMan

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfection
customer_reviews.text: This product has only 1 design shortcoming, which keeps it from garnering a 5 Star Rating. When the bars are unfurled, they do NOT click/lock into place. If the bar(s) are bumped even slightly, they move & then you must turn the large, black knob on top to fully unfurl/extend the bar(s). The solution would be a very easy fix/modification at the manufacturing level. The little ring (holding the black dial in place, should have a tension spring under it, and also a detent between the bottom of the knob and the spindle shaft.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang Crumplemint

customer_reviews.title: very handy
customer_reviews.text: love this when I don't have anyone around to help with batches
customer_reviews.author: Chrisann S

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Saves me tons of counter space when drying pasta. I used to use cookie cooling racks which would take up what limited counter space I have. My only complaint is I ordered only one. Good sturdy base, arms seem ligit and with proper care this drying rack should last.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Mulder

customer_reviews.title: Especially love the wand that transports the strands to the arms ...
customer_reviews.text: Sexy sleek and very well made... Worth the price and beats them wooden type hands down. Especially love the wand that transports the strands to the arms so beautifully....
customer_reviews.author: Audra Fong

customer_reviews.title: Marcato Atlas Pasta Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Christmas gift for my sister so she has not received it yet. However, it is the same one that my niece gave me a couple of years ago and I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sage

customer_reviews.title: Great Design
customer_reviews.text: this is definitely the Ferrari of pasta drying stands. worth every bit of money. it's stable, practical, so convenient and brilliantly designed. you can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: mak

customer_reviews.title: Really well constructed.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a lot of drying racks before deciding on this and I was right. This rack is well balanced. Swivels easily. I feel I get it completely cleaned because the surfaces are not porous. It is compact and worth every penny. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Augspurger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I prefer to make my own pasta and when I started I was using wax paper draped over hangers. What a pain! This product is a life saver. If you make your own pasta you absolutely must purchase this. This product is sturdy and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Cirque Fan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: The drying rack is well thought out--built well, too. The center rod is excellent to move cut pasta from machine to rack to pot.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: The pasta drying rack is great! It cleans up easily, folds down for easy storage and allows for lots of pasta to dry. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This rack is fantastic to use and easy to pop back into it's box for storage. I feel it's cleaner than useing a timber one too.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase and well worth the money. I would definitely recommend that you buy it as opposed to the cheaper wooden rack
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great item for home Pasta makers
customer_reviews.text: Great item at a good price. It looks good in my kitchen, and does not take up to much space, what more can I say...
customer_reviews.author: Albert Ingram

customer_reviews.title: compact pasta rack
customer_reviews.text: very nice well made pasta rack,the best part is the design which folds up easily for storage when not in use.We liked it so much we bought our daughter one.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Vandenberg

customer_reviews.title: pasta rack
customer_reviews.text: The rack is very helpful and easy to use. I highly reccomend it to the pasta lovers.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Fiorentini

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: still have it in my box no table room for it yet nice color blue hope it last 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Burns

customer_reviews.title: Simple design and essential kitchen tool for any pasta maker.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how you could make pasta without one. The height of the prongs is perfect and the pasta doesn't usually stick to them either. It is easy to wash and looks kind of cool. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's just fun -- not to mention helpful (and well made) when making a larger batch of pasta.
customer_reviews.author: K8

customer_reviews.title: Easy to store
customer_reviews.text: Simple. Easy to store. Love the wand that cuts and measures. We bought one used it for a long while and then bought another so we could do multiple batches of pasta. This holds about one batch of pasta-we do 500 grams flours and 5 eggs to give you an idea of the batch size.
customer_reviews.author: K&A

customer_reviews.title: Pasta Sticks to It.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. I love the plastic thing in the center, but I like my cheap wooden one better. It's pretty, so if you like bling, then go for it, but the pasta sticks something terrible. It makes sense when you think about it. How can it dry out underneath if it's draped over plastic or whatever it's made of. Good idea, but better if it were wood.
customer_reviews.author: rte

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes you just can't tell from the reviews. But I am 100% pleased with this holder. Much larger than I expected. Very stable with wide legs. Seems sturdy. I love the way it will compact itself for storage. A little pricey, but I feel I got my moneys worth. I am happy I did not go with a cheaper model.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hunt

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THE MARCATO ATLAS TACAPASTA!
customer_reviews.text: The Marcato Atlas Tacapasta is high quality, easy to use and it comes with the fantastic magic wand to pick up the pasta threads from the ATLAS 150 pasta machine. It's easy to store and clean, and overall a great product for what it is intended to do!
customer_reviews.author: Lizbeth Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Happy overall despite a couple minor annoyances
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this purchase over all. The only annoying features (and why I gave it 4 starts instead of 5) are: (1) The pegs are pretty close together, and the highest one overlaps a bit with the shortest one, so it's hard to get the pasta on one individual peg. The tool helps, though. (2) The bottom half of the pegs are really low, so the pasta inevitably drags on the counter. It's well made and does its job, other than those minor annoyances. I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Useful!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun and very useful item. I have started making homemade pasta again because of it! It doesn’t take up a lot of space, it’s easy to use and it looks very cool!
customer_reviews.author: ChefKat64

customer_reviews.title: very expensive plastic !
customer_reviews.text: This is my opinion is very expensive product not much can hold pasta ...very very disappoint , pasta stick to plastic I make mistake I don't Return !
customer_reviews.author: VESNA

customer_reviews.title: Great, but the only thing is
customer_reviews.text: Works great but the only thing it's tall, so it won't fit nicely on my counter. I wish I could push it back, but it hits the bottom of my cabinets so I have to keep it more in the middle of the countertop. Otherwise it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Copper Turquoise

customer_reviews.title: Takes very little space, holds a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more pleased. This rack takes hardly any place to store. Making pasta is already messy, and takes up a bit of kitchen space. Then finding a way to dry it takes creativity and even more space. This drying rack, when in use, sits on a little counter space, and holds an amazing amount of pasta. It couldn't be easier or more efficient, and is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: California Cherries

customer_reviews.title: works great, holds a lot of pasta and folds up well
customer_reviews.text: works great, holds a lot of pasta and folds up well. Only down side is that one of the arms has already broken off. This is because someone put a heavy pot on top of it in the drawer... so not really a manufacturing fault. Rather, it is awkward to find good places in the kitchen to store something with this shape even though it folds up. This is way more efficient for drying pasta than draping it over towels and sieves as I have done in the past. Very much recommend investing in this if you are going to make pasta more often than 2 or 3 times a year.
customer_reviews.author: A. Downing

customer_reviews.title: Best Pasta Drying Rack ever!
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a bamboo drying rack. Much cheaper, but not good to work with. The rods were so warped that they wouldn't go through the holes. This on is so easy to set up and use and it holds so much pasta easily! I gave the other rack to our local thrift shop and this one will be my choice from now on. I love how compact it is, how easy it is to twirl the rack out, how the legs go in to store it in a small space. Great design, great construction, great product!
customer_reviews.author: D Redding

customer_reviews.title: Broke after just a couple months,  maybe used a dozen times.....
customer_reviews.text: Broke after just a couple months, poor design with screw holding spindle in place, had to 'Macgyver' it to keep using.
customer_reviews.author: George O. Worthington

customer_reviews.title: Pasta Sticks To It
customer_reviews.text: This was a great idea. It is a nice design, it folds up neatly. But it has one crucial problem: the pasta sticks to it. I'm bummed because I can't really use it.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Thought out well, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully made as always. Gift for Mom she can't wait to use it
customer_reviews.author: Woodenvisions

customer_reviews.title: This is good to go and very high quality.
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this unit you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MikeR

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and breaks down to an easy storage size. Pretty on the counter too!
customer_reviews.author: Joy D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: This rack is wonderful. It has a tripod base which is very secure when on a table or counter, and the arms simply open when the knob at the top is turned. Inside the knob, a wand is included which can be used to transfer pasta from the machine to the drying rack easily. Wonderful! I am going to get several more of these for more room!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Prefer the wooden version
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and a wooden simpler rack, and we prefer the wooden one. Its not aesthetic or natural looking is the reason. It is fine functionally, but I find we prefer a simpler type.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Top Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this pasta drying rack. It folds up, so it stores nicely without taking up too much space. I finally figured out how to use the "tool" that is stored in the top. No real directions on the box, just a picture. It is cupped so that it fits perfectly over the spokes. Hold it under the pasta while you are cutting it and then transfer the pasta to the spokes.
customer_reviews.author: Valeriect

customer_reviews.title: outstanding quality!
customer_reviews.text: i ordered the Marcato pasta machine and accessories. outstanding quality!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: One More Happy Pasta Maker
customer_reviews.text: The previous reviewers have pretty much covered the details of this product, but I am so pleased with this drying rack that I wanted to put my "five stars" in too. This rack is compact, holds an amazing amount of pasta, is ready to go right out of the box, and is a snap to clean. It is well-designed and the quality is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: KatieG

customer_reviews.title: Simple Review
customer_reviews.text: OK - If you are looking for a pasta drying rack right now and are reading reviews - STOP HERE. BUY THIS UNIT & CALL IT GOOD. This is the best unit you can and will ever buy. Just get it, that's all I can say. And get it for a friend or family member who also enjoys making pasta, if you don't, you'll wish you did. It's so cool and so very functional.
customer_reviews.author: Chef

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than what I have used in the past. My mother used to use a broom covered in wax paper, suspended off the backs of two kitchen chairs. It always worked for me too. That is until I found my goofy and apparently, very hungry German Shepherd eating my Linguini!
customer_reviews.author: Belles

customer_reviews.title: Pasta Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: Since coming back from visiting Italy and having fresh homemade pasta everyday, I decided to try making my own. I already had a pasta machine but had no way to dry it. I found this one on Amazon for a very reasonable price. The legs fold up for storage and the arms swing out and in for drying and storage. Very easy tool to have to make the pasta making experience fun.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia G. Cullivan

customer_reviews.title: Must have rack!
customer_reviews.text: Love my pasta rack and may need to buy another as I like to make large batches of pasta! I also love how easy it is to store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great drying rack
customer_reviews.text: A perfect way to dry pasta - simple and neat! I have no negative comments.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like, if Italians like it.
customer_reviews.text: Any pasta drying rack that is endorsed by Italians can't be bad, in fact it must be pretty good. This is better than good, it's great. It folds up and stores neatly. I'm really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Roy R. Riggs

product_meta.title: Marcato Atlas Pasta Drying Rack, Tacapasta, Made in Italy, Steel and Polycarbonate, Collapsible, Blue
product_meta.description:
Color:Blue

Marcato’s Atlas Pasta Drying Rack offers ample space for drying up to 4.4-pounds of all types of long noodles and homemade pastas. Nothing tastes better than homemade pasta. Fresh pasta made in advance can be dried and stored for later use, or hang it to keep it from sticking until the cooking pot is at a rolling boil. Marcato’s Tacapasta Pasta Drying Rack features 16 rods (each measuring 8-inches long) that quickly fan out for fast access to drying space. A multipurpose wand picks up freshly cut pasta for safe transport to the drying rack or cooking pot and stores neatly in the central column when not in use. Perfect for drying all types of long noodles, like spaghetti and fettuccine noodles, angel hair, fettuccini, fusilli, lasagna, even lo mein noodles, and more. It folds down for easy, compact storage. Made in Italy from steel and polycarbonate, Marcato’s Pasta Drying Rack is sturdy and durable, and wipes clean with a dry cloth or brush. Comes complete with instructions and 10-year manufacturer’s warranty. Available exclusively from HIC Harold Import Co.
feature_bullets: Marcato’s Atlas pasta drying Rack offers ample space for drying up to 4.4-Pounds of all types of long noodles and homemade pastas
Made in Italy from steel and polycarbonate; sturdy and durable; 16 rods (8-inches Each) fan out for quick access and close up for easy compact storage
Multipurpose wand picks up freshly cut pasta and transports it to the drying rack or cooking pot and stores neatly in the central column
Easily dry all long noodles, like spaghetti and fettuccine noodles, Angel hair, fettuccini, fusilli, lasagna, even yellow mein noodles, and more
Measures 18.5 x 2.75-Inches; wipe clean with a Dry brush or cloth; Available exclusively from HIC Harold Import Co; 10-year manufacturer’s warranty
